definition: oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning

sentences.english: I don’t want to be too glib, however. There are a couple of key differences
sentences.chinese: 無論如何，我不想太油嘴滑舌。
他是一個油嘴滑舌的推銷員。

sentences.english: He was tired of those mealy-mouthed politicians.
sentences.chinese: 他膩煩那些油嘴滑舌的政客。

sentences.english: Jim, ” he says, “I’m not buying your line of shit.”
sentences.chinese: 吉姆，”他說，“我纔不相信你那油嘴滑舌的話呢。”
我恨那個油嘴滑舌的傢伙。

sentences.english: I don't like those slippery salesmen.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡那些油嘴滑舌的推銷員。

sentences.english: I don't want to be too glib, however. There are a couple of key differences
sentences.chinese: 無論如何，我不想太油嘴滑舌。有兩個關鍵區別

sentences.english: Oh look, there goes my gluttonous older brother smooth-talking again.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，我那貪喫的哥哥又開始油嘴滑舌了。

definition: flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
(coll.) to wag one's tongue/to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes/to chatter endlessly/to speak glibly
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
heart and mouth at variance (idiom); keeping one's real intentions to oneself/saying one thing but meaning sth different
(fig.) adaptable/able to deal with various kinds of people and situations/(derog.) insincere/two-faced
pinyin: jian4 ren2 shuo1 ren2 hua4 , jian4 gui3 shuo1 gui3 hua4
related.word: 見人說人話，見鬼說鬼話
